revised_title: Photosensitivity of Visual Purple and Scotopic Sensitivity in the Ultra-Violet
tldr: This article investigates the photosensitivity of visual purple solutions and the scotopic sensitivity of the eye in the ultra-violet region. The authors found that visual purple is sensitive to ultra-violet light, and the retina should be sensitive to this range of light. They also discovered that aphakic eyes are more sensitive to ultra-violet light than ordinary eyes, and the mechanism of vision appears to be the same as for ordinary visible light.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vision and Visual System
